page.title: 05WILDFLOWERS IN NEWTONMORE 5
page.content:
126.Nipplewort,127.Heather, 128.Field Gentian.
We chose this contribution to highlight our concern over the misuse of the earth's resources by industrial man. Could it be that the environmental pollution will increase over the next few years? What will it be like in 100 years from now? This survey of the natural flowering species on the golf course in Newtonmore could act as a baseline for future measures of environmental damage. At the moment the beech tree in the Headmaster's garden (Fagaceae sylvatica ) has shown leaf damage for the first time in about 70 years. When will governments accept that the acid rain problem of N.W.Europe is preventable?
